Aeris.js

The Aeris Weather API is one of the most complete and advanced weather APIs available and quickly gives you access to many different types of weather information.

Out of the box, Aeris.js provides a suite of tools for rendering weather maps and widgets, using data from the Aeris API. Maps can be rendered using the [Google Maps API or OpenLayers.

Usage of the Aeris API requires an Aeris API developer account. Visit hamweather.com to sign up for a free account.

  • aeris.maps.layers.Radar
  • extends AerisTile

Representation of an Aeris Radar layer.

constructor
new aeris.maps.layers.Radar(opt_attrs, opt_options);
Parameter Type Description
opt_attrs Object Radar layer attributes optional
opt_attrs Object optional
methods
Method Return value Description
setMap(map:Map) none Add the radar layer to a map.
getMap() Map
events
See aeris.Events documentation for information about handling events
load
Radar.on('load', function(radarLayer, status) {});
Event parameter Type Description
layer AbstractTile The layer which has been loaded.
status LayerLoadedStatus Status of the loaded layer.
load:error
Radar.on('load:error', function(loadingError) {});
Event parameter Type Description
layer AbstractTile The layer which has been loaded.
status LayerLoadedStatus Status of the loaded layer.
